The numbers $ \log(a^3b^7)$, $ \log(a^5b^{12})$, and $ \log(a^8b^{15})$ are the first three terms of an arithmetic sequence, and the $ 12^\text{th}$ term of the sequence is $ \log{b^n}$. What is $ n$?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 40 \qquad
\textbf{(B)}\ 56 \qquad
\textbf{(C)}\ 76 \qquad
\textbf{(D)}\ 112 \qquad
\textbf{(E)}\ 143$
